channel.title: Error in compile
channel.description:
I am a complete noob when it comes to this, so can some1 help plz?
When I run comple it gives the following error:
client.java:150: ';' expected isRunning2 = false; ^ 1 error --------------Project16: Enabled---------------
The code in compile is the following: [code]@echo off COLOR 08 title CPRS Server "C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_06injavac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_06in/java.exe" server pause[/code]
I searched all the help files but didnt find anyhting like it..[br][size=1]Posted at: November 20, 2006, 08:21:39 AM[/size][hr]can any1 help with this???

item.title: Error in compile
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

[quote=“urion2, post:6, topic:27267”]its not the .9 thing…
Java is the latest version…
not simicolon thing either…[/quote]

It is the semicolon. That’s why it tells you that the problem is that it’s missing a semicolon. Pay attention.

Read full topic

item.title: Error in compile
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Go to the end of line 150 in client.java and add a semicolon.

[quote=“Indiantiger, post:2, topic:27267”]did u change the 0_06 to 0_09?
maybe thats the problem[/quote]
No.

Javacisnotrecognized:

You have to actually change it to the version of Java you have installed. Its in C:\Program Files\Java\

No. Are you paying attention?

Read full topic

item.description:
@urion2 wrote:

I am a complete noob when it comes to this, so can some1 help plz?

When I run comple it gives the following error:

client.java:150: ‘;’ expected
isRunning2 = false;
^
1 error
--------------Project16: Enabled---------------

The code in compile is the following:

@echo off COLOR 08 title CPRS Server "C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_06injavac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_06in/java.exe" server pause

I searched all the help files but didnt find anyhting like it…[br][size=1]Posted at: November 20, 2006, 08:21:39 AM[/size][hr]can any1 help with this???
